title: "Slide Sitemap"
output: html_document
---

Welcome to the slide sitemap. This page contains links to all of the slides in this repository. I use this page to help me navigate the slides for the Methods in Psychological Research course.


```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(gt)
library(tidyverse)
library(stringi)


make_full = function(myurl,gituser="psychmethods",myrepo="slides") {
  paste0('https://',gituser,'.github.io/',myrepo,'/',myurl)
# paste0('https://',gituser,'.github.io/',myurl)
}
make_hyperlink = function(myurl,mytext=myurl) {
  paste0('<a href="',myurl,'">',mytext,'</a>')
}

df_docs<-list.files(path="../slides/.", '[.]html$', recursive=TRUE) %>%
  str_subset("setup.html", negate=TRUE) %>%
  str_subset("index.html", negate=TRUE) %>%
  str_subset("slides_old/test.html", negate=TRUE) %>%
  str_subset("wXX_demo.html", negate=TRUE)


#df_docs=list.files( '[.]html$', recursive=TRUE)


df <- data.frame(
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE,
      #        title = str_replace_all(str_remove(df_docs, "\\.html"),"[_-]"," "),
              title = str_remove(df_docs, "\\.html"),  
              link = make_full(df_docs)
) 


df %>% # remove double slides/slides
    mutate( link = str_replace(link, "/slides/slides/", "/slides/"),
        link = glue::glue("[slides]({link})"),
        link = map(link, gt::md)) %>%
    gt()

```
